metadata.title: Block IP - Take Action from Teams - Cisco Firepower
metadata.description: This playbook sends an adaptive card to the SOC Teams Channel to allow analyst response on Cisco Firepower.
mainSteps: 1. For each IP in the incident, check if it is already selected for the Network Group object.

2. An adaptive card is sent to a Teams channel with information about the incident and giving the option to ignore an IP, or depdening on it's current status block it by adding it to the Network Group object or unblock it by removing it from the Network Group object
3. The chosen changes are applied to the Network Group object
4. Comment is added to Azure Sentinel incident
prerequisites: 1. In Cisco Firepower there needs to be a Network Group object. [Creating Network Objects](https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/security/firepower/630/configuration/guide/fpmc-config-guide-v63/reusable_objects.html#ariaid-title15)

2. Cisco Firepower custom connector needs to be deployed prior to the deployment of this playbook, in the same resource group and region. Relevant instructions can be found in the [connector doc](https://github.com/Azure/Azure-Sentinel/tree/master/Playbooks/CiscoFirepower/CustomConnector#deployment-instructions)

metadata.description: Name of the Logic Apps resource to be created

api.id: [concat('/subscriptions/', subscription().subscriptionId, '/resourceGroups/', resourceGroup().name, '/providers/Microsoft.Web/customApis/', parameters('Cisco Firepower Connector name'))]

body.message:
Cisco Firepower playbook run summary
The incident did not have any entities with IPs.

Terminate:_No_IPs_found.description: Since we don't have any IPs, all other actions can be skipped.

Entities_has_any_IPs.description: If the Entities does not have any IPs for this incident, we terminate the Logic App

Filter_Network_group_object_items_array.description: The filter with nameOrValue will also return items that start with the name, for example the 'Network Group object name' is 'TEST' and there is a network group object named 'TEST_2' that will also be returned.

body.message:
Cisco Firepower playbook run summary
We could not find the Network Group object with name: '@{variables('Network Group object name')}'

Cisco Firepower playbook run summary
We could not find the Network Group object with name: '@{variables('Network Group object name')}'

Cisco Firepower playbook run summary
The following IPs were found in the Incident:
@{variables('ipAddressesActionComment')}

inputs.name: ipAddressesActionComment
inputs.value: @{items('For_each_over_IPAddresses')?['IPAddress']} - is already blocked in Cisco Firepower

inputs.name: ipAddressesActionComment
inputs.value: @{items('For_each_over_ipAddresses')['IPAddress']} - no action taken in Cisco Firepower

body.updateMessage: Thanks for your response, it is being processed.

Cisco-Firepower-connector.id: [concat('/subscriptions/', subscription().subscriptionId, '/resourceGroups/', resourceGroup().name, '/providers/Microsoft.Web/customApis/', parameters('Cisco Firepower Connector name'))]
